intro: Erigeron foliosus var. hartwegii, commonly known as Hartweg's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and blue to purple in color. This variety is distinguished by its unique foliage and floral structure, making it a notable species in its native range.
